intro: Cotyledon cristata, commonly known as the cristate cotyledon, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique, wavy, and crinkled leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water, making it well-suited for arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers during the warmer months, adding to its ornamental value.
